Hi, 

SAP IBP has an Application Job to accomplish the standard analytics to your planning area.

The Application Job name is: Import Best Practice Analytics Stories

Add Prefix of three characters and execute the job.

You can modify the Stories based on your clients requirements and scenarios (similar to what we do for Planner Workspace, Excel Templates).

entry.title: [Soon] Workshop de SAP Analytics Cloud: Transforme Datos en Insights Valiosos
entry.content:
El próximo 5 de diciembre, viernes, no se pierdan el emocionante workshop de SAP Analytics Cloud, un taller práctico de 4 horas que les permitirá explorar y aprovechar al máximo las capacidades de esta poderosa herramienta de análisis de datos.

¿Qué es SAP Analytics Cloud?

SAP Analytics Cloud es una solución integral de análisis de datos que permite a las empresas tomar decisiones basadas en datos en tiempo real. Con sus capacidades avanzadas de visualización de datos, análisis predictivo y planificación, SAP Analytics Cloud proporciona a los usuarios una visión profunda y detallada de sus datos, ayudándoles a identificar tendencias, oportunidades y desafíos comerciales.

¿Por qué asistir?

Este workshop, ministrado por Marcela Revilla, Senior SAP Consultant Instructor, está diseñado para ofrecerles una experiencia completa y enriquecedora. Marcela, con su amplia experiencia en integración de procesos de negocio y configuración de sistemas, les guiará a través de aulas teóricas y ejercicios prácticos, asegurando que adquieran habilidades valiosas que pueden aplicar inmediatamente en su trabajo.

Detalles del Workshop

  • Duración: 4 horas
  • Instructor: Marcela Revilla, Senior SAP Consultant Instructor
  • Certificación: Todos los participantes recibirán un certificado de participación al finalizar el taller.

Inscripción

Para inscribirse, pronto se proporcionarán más detalles. entry.title: Re: SELECT with ORDER BY
entry.content:
ORDER BY udate utime DESCENDING does NOT mean both fields are sorted descending. ABAP applies the it only to the last field unless explicitly stated. Try this:

SELECT *
FROM jcds
INTO TABLE lt_jcds
WHERE objnr = lv_objnr
AND cdtcode IN ('IW31','IW32')
ORDER BY udate DESCENDING,
utime DESCENDING.

entry.title: Re: PR Average workflow time issue
entry.content:
Hi,

Please refer to KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/0003342696

and content in help portal to know about the apps key features: Purchase Requisition Average Approval Time - Flexible Workflow 

This behavior is confirmed in SAP KBA 3342696 (Currency conversion error in aging analysis apps), which explains that many analytical apps—including PR Average Approval Time—will fail to load data if the system is missing an exchange rate between two currencies for the specific date being evaluated.

Validity: The rate must be valid for or before the date shown in the error message. Once the exchange rate is added, the PR Average Approval Time app will load successfully. Please, set the conversion rate from a date covering all PRs created in your system (for example, from 1970). 

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: BP user exits to check data before saving (SAP GUI transaction for Business Partners)
entry.content:
I've read a few questions and answers about which user exit to choose to add custom checks before saving in the SAP GUI transaction BP (maintenance of business partners), but without understanding which ones to choose, how they are all related, what they exactly do. I'm trying here to provide an overview of what I have quickly understood.

I'm running S/4HANA 2023 FPS 1 (ABAP 7.58 SP 1).

In short, there are these user exits, called sequentially:

  • the BP checks by the BDT framework (Business Data Toolset),
  • the BP checks by the BAdI BUPA_FURTHER_CHECKS,
  • the vendor or customer specific checks by the BAdI VENDOR_EXTENSION_CHECK and CUSTOMER_EXTENSION_CHECK.
  • NB: if I understand well, S/4HANA has merged customer and vendor maintenance into BP, and before S/4HANA, there were specific vendor and customer user exits (not part of BP) which were the Business Transaction Events 1340 and 1440 and the BAdI CUSTOMER_ADD_DATA and VENDOR_ADD_DATA, method CHECK_ALL_DATA. I don't discuss them here.

In BP, the BDT checks are first called. You may create your own function module (no parameters) and add it to the transaction code BUS7 for the event DCHCK. For the sequence number, you may enter any two last characters (positions 6 and 7) other than "00" (double zero), because the positions are reserved for custom use, as explained in the SAP Help Portal:

  • Naming convention: The position number has 7 places. Each development stage has one place of its own. The places from the left up to your own place are freely assignable. The application uses them to determine the position of the view within a section in relation to the views of the upstream development stages. The numbers to the right of your own place must be ‘0’.
  • The following places are reserved for the development stages:
  • Application basis 1+2
  • Standard applications 3
  • Industry applications 4
  • Development partners 5
  • Customers (central) 6
  • Customers (branch) 7

Then, the method CHECK_CENTRAL of the Classic BAdI BUPA_FURTHER_CHECKS is called. You may also implement it (transaction code SE18, menu Implementations > Create). This method receives few parameters (table BUT000, name, organization data, person data). If you need other data from the business partner, you may call function modules like BUP_BUPA_BUT0IS_GET (table BUT0IS being the industry sectors defined at the BP level) to get the data modified (or not) by the user, before the data is really saved to the database.

After that, if the partner is of type vendor, BP calls the method CHECK of the BAdI Definition VENDOR_EXTENSION_CHECK of the Enhancement Spot VENDOR_EXTENSION.

If the partner of type customer, BP calls the method CHECK of the BAdI Definition CUSTOMER_EXTENSION_CHECK of the Enhancement Spot CUSTOMER_EXTENSION.

The two BAdI above receive only the vendor or customer specific data, not the whole business partner data, to prevent saving the data to the vendor or customer specific tables LFA1, KNA1 (and so on), but even if an error is raised by the user exit, the business partner data is saved.

In my case, I wanted to define a blocking check on BP data, the most simple way, so I used the classic BAdI BUPA_FURTHER_CHECKS.

For information, if you want to know about how the vendor or customer specific data is filtered out from the business partner data, it's done by the class CVI_STRATEGY_BP_VENDOR, in the method IF_MDS_CTRL_STRATEGY_IMPL~PROCESS.

I don't know how exactly the BP customizing decides how to display the vendor or customer data, and how it's saved into the tables LFA1, KNA1, etc. What I could understand:

  1. If you create a Business Partner, you choose a partner group from the table TB000 (e.g. PCUS, PVEN)
  2. The SPRO activity "Define partner role from client to partner" (SM30 > CVIV_CUST_TO_BP2) assigns one or more partner roles (e.g. FLCU00) to the partner group (e.g. PCUS).
  3. The SPRO activity "Define partner role from vendor to partner" (SM30 > CVIV_VEND_TO_BP2) assigns one or more partner roles (e.g. FLVN00) to a partner group (e.g. PVEN).
  4. The SPRO activity "Define partner roles" (SM34 > BUPA_TB003) links the partner role (e.g. FLCU00) to the BDT partner view (e.g. FLCU00). This BDT partner view is defined in the transaction BUSD and is connected to Dynpro screens with ABAP logic. It's not clear to me how, from here, some BDT partner function modules are called at save time and how they write to either the table LFA1 (vendor) or KNA1 (customer).
  5. The SPRO activity "Assign partner role to client group" (V_TBD001) assigns a client group from KNA1-KTOKD (e.g. CUST) to a partner group (e.g. PCUS). This customizing indicates if the client number is the same as the partner number. For information, the relationship table is CVI_CUST_LINK.
  6. The SPRO activity "Assign partner role to vendor group" (V_TBC001) assigns a vendor group from LFA1-KTOKK (e.g. VEND) to a partner group (e.g. PVEN). This customizing indicates if the vendor number is the same as the partner number. For information, the relationship table is CVI_VEND_LINK.

If I've missed something, if I'm wrong or if you can enlighten me, please add a comment. I will then update this post.

Thank you for reading!

entry.title: HCM Brasil: Nova Isenção do IRRF para Rendimentos de até R$ 5.000,00
entry.content:
Olá pessoal! Temos novidade importante sobre o IRRF. Em 26 de novembro de 2025 o presidente sancionou a lei que amplia a faixa de isenção do IRRF para rendimentos mensais de até R$ 5.000. A medida entra em vigor em janeiro de 2026 e deve atingir cerca de 15 milhões de contribuintes.

O que muda na prática?

As principais alterações incluem:

  • Isenção total para rendas mensais de até R$ 5.000.
  • Desconto progressivo para rendas entre R$ 5.001 e R$ 7.350 mensais.
  • Aplicação nas folhas regulares, férias e décimo terceiro salário.

Exemplos aproximados de impacto:

  • Para um salário de R$ 5.000, a redução no desconto do IRRF pode chegar a até R$ 312,89 por mês (valor ilustrativo — ver observação abaixo).
  • Para um salário de R$ 7.000, o benefício estimado é de aproximadamente R$ 46,61 por mês.

Observação: os exemplos acima são estimativas. A metodologia de cálculo pode ser ajustada nas instruções normativas e notas técnicas da Receita Federal/eSocial. Recomenda-se validar os valores após a publicação dos atos regulamentares.

Impactos nos Sistemas de Folha de Pagamento?

Essa alteração exigirá adaptações em todos os processos de processamento de folha:

  • Nova lógica após o cálculo pela tabela progressiva atual.
  • Aplicação de fórmula específica para a faixa intermediária.
  • Ajustes também para férias e 13º salário.

Posicionamento da SAP

A SAP já está analisando a legislação desde a aprovação no Senado. Aguardamos as publicações finais (Instrução Normativa da RFB, Nota Técnica do eSocial, etc.) para apresentar um plano definitivo de entrega e orientações técnicas.

Onde acompanhar as atualizações?

Vocês podem acompanhar este tópico no Regulatory Change Manager através do link: https://app.main.regulatory-change-manager.cloud.sap/index.html#/detail/GSREQAMER-15494

IMPORTANTE: As regulamentações adicionais podem alterar detalhes técnicos e impactos operacionais.

Reforçamos que as alterações legais que impactam a localização de folha de pagamento para o Brasil são disponibilizadas no Regulatory Change Manager.

Gostou desse post? Dê um Like e compartilhe o conteúdo com seus colegas.

Fiquem à vontade para deixar um feedback, comentário ou pergunta sobre este Blog post no espaço abaixo. E não esqueçam de seguir a tag HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para ficarem ligados nas últimas notícias.

Um abraço,

Leandro D’Avila

entry.title: A Practical Guide to Extending Standard Billing Forms in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
One of the most frequent topics customers seek guidance on is how they can tailor their business documents to reflect their unique brand and operational needs. While the standard forms we deliver are a fantastic starting point, your billing document is a key touchpoint with your customers, and it needs to be just right.

Today, I’m going to walk you through a practical, step-by-step guide on how to extend the standard billing document form template to meet some of the most common business requirements. We'll cover adding your company logo, including standard and custom fields, adding static text, and even generating multiple copies such as customer copy or archive copy of a single invoice.

Let’s get started!

The Core Tools of the Trade

Before we dive into the details, let's familiarize ourselves with the key applications and tools we will be using in the SAP Fiori launchpad:

1. Maintain Form Templates App: This is your central hub for managing all form templates. Here, you can copy standard templates, download the layout files, upload your modified versions, and activate them.
2. Custom Fields App: A powerful application that allows you to create your own business-specific fields and make them available in various business contexts, including form templates.
3. Output Parameter Determination App: After you have a beautiful new form, this app is where you define the business rules that tell the system when to use it (e.g., for a specific company code, sales organization, or customer).

Adobe LiveCycle Designer: This is the design tool used to edit the visual layout of the form. You will need to have it installed on your local machine (available via app Install Additional Software).


Step 1: Create Your Custom Form Template

SAP delivers default form templates that you can copy to create your own custom form templates

1. Open the Maintain Form Templates app, and navigate to the Predelivered Templates tab..
2. Search for SDBIL_CI_STANDARD* to find the standard templates for customer invoices.You will see localized versions like “SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_US” or “SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_DE”.
3. Select the standard template that best fits your region and select Copy.
4. Give your new template a name. For example: `YY1_MYCORP_BILLING_FORM_US`.
5. Click OK.


Step 2: Download the Layout and Make Basic Changes

Now that you have your custom copy, let's download the layout file and add some fundamental customizations.

1. On the Custom Templates tab, search for your new template.

2. Open the form template, then select Download.

3 Save and extract the zip archive. The archive contains the form template as an XDP file, data provider information in XSD format, and optionally, the form template master, also as an XDP file.

You are now in the design environment. On the left, you'll see the `Hierarchy` and `Data View` tabs. The `Data View` shows all the data fields available from the system, while the `Hierarchy` shows the structure of the form itself.


Common Requirement: Adding a Company Logo

The recommended way to manage logos in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with the Manage Logos app. You upload your logo there and it gets a unique name. The form can then pull it dynamically.

1. Open the XDP file via Adobe LiveCycle Designer

2. In LiveCycle Designer, find the placeholder for the logo (it's often an Image Field object at the top).
3. Select the Image Field and go to the Object  palette.
4. Ensure the Embed Image Data option is unchecked.
5. Go to the Binding palette. You should see a binding reference like `$record.Form_Header.Logo.URL`. This tells the form to fetch the logo URL provided by the system. By using the Manage Logos app and this binding will work automatically.


Common Requirement: Adding Static Text (e.g., Terms & Conditions)

1. In the Hierarchy view, find the content area where you want to add the text (e.g., `contentArea`).
2. Drag a Text object from the Object Library onto your form's design view.
3. Double-click the new text object and type or paste your terms and conditions.
4. In the Layout palette, make sure the Expand to Fit options are checked so the text block can grow as needed.

Step 3: Extending the Form with Custom Fields

This is where the real power of extensibility shines. Let's say you need to add a "Project Manager" name to your billing documents, a field that doesn't exist in the standard system.

Part A: Create the Custom Field in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

1. Open the Custom Fields app.
2. Click the +icon to create a new field.
3. Select the Select the business context Sales: Billing Document. This is crucial as it determines where the field can be used.
4. Provide a label for your field (e.g., “Project Manager”). Based on the label, the system suggests an identifier, for example, “YY1_ProjectManager
5. Choose a Type, such as `Text`, and set the length.
6. Navigate to the Form Templates tab. Find the data source and check the Enable Usage box.
7. (Recommended) Navigate to the User Interfaces tab. Enable the field for `Manage Billing Documents` and `Create Billing Documents` (business context - Sales: Billing Due List) so you can see and edit it directly in the Fiori apps.
8. Save and Publish your field. This process can take a few minutes.


Part B: Update the Form Data Source and Layout

1. Go back to the Maintain Form Templates app.
2. Open your custom template (`YY1_MYCORP_BILLING_FORM_US`).
3. Download the form template again. This is a critical step! Downloading the template again ensures the XDP 's schema is updated with the new custom field you just published.
4. Open the new XDP file in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.
5. Go to the Data View tab. Expand the nodes to find your new field, YY1_ProjectManager.

6.Drag your new field from the `Data View` and drop it onto the form canvas where you want it to appear. A caption and a text field will be created automatically.
7. Style and position the new field to match the rest of your form.

Step 4: Upload and Activate Your Masterpiece

Once you are happy with all your changes, it's time to upload the form back into the system.

1. Save your XDP file in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.

2. Return to the Maintain Form Templates app in the SAP Fiori launchpad.

3. On the Custom Templates tab, choose New.

4. In the Create Form Template window, enter the form template name.

5. To specify the location of the custom template XDP, choose Browse.

6. From the Data Provider dropdown list, select FDP_V3_BD_STANDARD_SRV.

7. To generate the custom template, choose OK.

8. Finally, assign the form to a Business Context using configuration activity: Assign Form Templates. Your form is now live and ready to be used.

Step 5: Define When to Use Your New Form

The last step is to tell the system the business rules for when to use your new form. This is done in the Output Parameter Determination app.

1. Open the app and select Billing Document from the Show Rules for dropdown.
2. Select the Form Template determination step.
3. In edit mode, create a new rule in the Decision Table. You can set conditions like: use `YY1_MYCORP_BILLING_FORM_US` IF `Company Code` is `1010`, or IF `Sales Organization` is `US01`.
4. Activate the new rule.

 

Common Requirement: Generate multiple output items – KBA 2757763 - How to print to multiple print queues or generate multiple output items.

Now, when a billing document is created that matches your conditions, the system will automatically use your beautifully customized form template.

Bonus tip on optimized handling of large data files :

In certain business processes, the form data XML can get too large and form rendering is rejected from the Adobe Document Services.
In such cases, you can try the following options to reduce the size of the form data XML:

• Use the 'Untag PDF' option in the 'Assign Form Templates' configuration activity.
Depending on your configuration environment, you do configuration activities in either the Manage Your Solution app or in SAP Central Business Configuration. To access the documentation for configuration activities, open the Actions menu and select 'Configuration Help' (for Manage Your Solution) or choose 'Open Documentation' in the documentation column (for Central Business Configuration).

• Use the 'Optimize data service' option in the 'Maintain Form Templates' app.
By default, during form rendering all data fields contained in the form data provider are sent to the Adobe Document Services for rendering. When enabling the newly introduced flag: Optimize data service the underlying template source will be statically analyzed. Only data fields that are directly used in a data binding by form elements will be transferred. This reduces the data transfer volume and improve the rendering performance.

Note that only data fields that are bound to an element in the form template will be detected and kept. Data fields that are only accessed via scripting are not supported. You can check existing data bindings by using the data view control in the Adobe LiveCycle Designer for SAP Solutions.

SAP recommends testing the output by generating a preview when enabling this feature.


Further Reading

For more in-depth information, please refer to these official resources:

* Setting Up Output Management - 1LQ Set Up Guide

* SAP Community : How to Bring Custom Fields to Billing Document Output (Video Tutorial)

* SAP Help Portal: Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition -> Document and Output Management

* SAP Help Portal : Output Management for Sales Documents and Billing Process Documents

* KBA 2984817 - Form design in Adobe LiveCycle Designer


I hope this guide empowers you to take control of your form templates. Customizing your business documents is a fantastic way to improve communication with your customers and streamline your own internal processes.

Happy customizing!

entry.title: Re: Early lot creation with multiple stock posting
entry.content: this is bad behaviour it supose to take the GR as many times as i can

entry.title: Re: Early lot creation with multiple stock posting
entry.content: Early Inspection Issue – Case 1 A production order is created for 10,000 PC, and an early inspection lot is automatically generated with a lot quantity of 10,000 PC. Results recording (RR) and usage decision (UD) are completed. After that, the production team posts a partial goods receipt of 1,000 PC. As a result, the system will show this 1,000 PC in the stock posting tab, and if you post this 1,000 PC to unrestricted, for example, the system puts this 1,000 PC as the actual lot qty and all stock posting fields are grayed out (disabled). From this point on, any additional goods receipts posted through MIGO are automatically posted directly to unrestricted stock, without appearing in QA32 under the inspection lot. As a result, QA32 does not display the subsequent received quantities, which appears to be a system defect.

entry.title: Re: Early lot creation with multiple stock posting
entry.content:
Case 2
If you create an early inspection lot for 10,000 PC, RR is done, and UD is not done yet. This partial qty of 6,000 PC is received in MIGO (GR from production order), then you move them to unrestricted stock from QA32. The system will take this 6,000 pc as the lot actual qty. Then, if you do any other GR for the rest of the order qty, for example the remaining 4,000 PC again, the system will create a new inspection lot with the remaining 4,000 PC which is strange behaviour. We are supposed to use this inspection lot to get only 1 inspection lot per order. So the solution is to prevent any stock posting done until someone makes sure there will not be any more GR on this production order. Do a user status without status number to be able to get it in the Selection Profile for the QA32 screen to use it for reporting.

entry.title: Now Productive: New FinOps Capabilities in SAP BTP
entry.content:
We are continuously evolving the FinOps capabilities within the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) to empower you with the tools you need to manage your cloud spend effectively.

Following the previous blog,  where we introduced beta functionalities for Budgets and Cloud Credits Forecast, we are pleased to announce that both features are now productively available. In addition, we are launching a brand-new Overview tab in the Costs and Usage page, serving as your central FinOps dashboard.

Let’s take a closer look at what is new and what is coming next:

1. Productive Availability: Budgets and Cloud Credits Forecast

We are happy to announce that Budgets and Cloud Credits Forecast, previously available in beta, are now officially released for productive use.

With Budgets, you can proactively monitor your spending by setting limits for your global account or specific organizational units and optionally choosing specific plans. Configurable alerts ensure you are notified before you exceed your amount limit, allowing for timely intervention. Complementing this is the Cloud Credits Forecast, which uses historical data to predict future credit usage. This capability helps you anticipate cloud credits exceedance and making informed decisions to adjust credit purchases and reduce the risks of future costs. For more information, see previous blog.

2. The New 'Overview' Tab: Your FinOps Dashboard

The highlight of this announcement is the new Overview tab within the Costs and Usage page in the SAP BTP Cockpit. This tab serves as a central entry point for key insights and recommendations for BTP FinOps, providing a clear, high-level view of your cloud spend at a glance. It is available for global accounts using consumption based commercial model or both consumption and subscription based commercial models.

While the existing Billing and Usage tabs provide the granular details needed for deep-dive analysis, the Overview tab offers a quick status update and immediate answers to your BTP financial questions, without requiring you to navigate through complex data tables.  If you need additional information, you can easily explore further details by expanding specific cards or following the relevant links throughout the interface.

Key insights available on the Overview tab include:

  • Monthly Costs Summary: Provides quick summary of your costs over the last 12 months. This card provides a comparison against previous months, helping you spot trends or anomalies immediately.
  • Consumption based commercial model: Shows the status of your consumption-based model, including a monthly cost trend for your global account over the last 12 months
  • Last Month's Prepaid Quota Consumption: For global accounts using both consumption and subscription based commercial models, this card offers visibility into the utilization of your prepaid quota. It helps you understand service usage relative to your subscription-based plans so you can manage your quota more effectively. Usage within your prepaid quota is covered by your subscription-based commercial models, while any usage beyond it is billed under your consumption-based commercial models.
  • Cost Breakdown and Distribution: Visualizes where your money is mostly spent by subaccount or service plan, making it easy to identify high-cost subaccounts (such as projects, teams or applications) or service plans over the last 12 months.
  • Cost-Related Recommendations: Provides actionable insights and automated optimization suggestions based on your global account’s cost and usage patterns, helping you to proactively manage your cloud spend, prevent unexpected expenses, and optimize resource planning. Recommendations may include:
    • Budget Management: Suggestions to set up or renew budgets and alerts when budget amounts or thresholds are exceeded.
    • Cloud Credits Overage Forecasted: Informs if cloud credits are forecasted to be exceeded soon or alerts if current cloud credits have been exceeded, advising monitoring or purchasing additional cloud credits.
    • Cost Spikes – Identifies unusual increases in costs for subaccounts and the entire global account compared to historical patterns, encouraging review of detailed cost data to investigate the cause.
  • Quick links (bottom card): Provides quick access to useful resources, such as billing information and details related to your consumption-based commercial model.

You may notice that some of these cards were previously displayed in the Costs and Usage page header and have now been moved to the Overview tab. As a result, the Billing, Usage, and Budgets tabs no longer include the page header, giving you more screen space and improved visibility for detailed information.

For more information, see documentation.

3. Recent Innovations Already Available

As you learn about new capabilities, we also want to ensure you’re aware of existing cost-management features, such as the SAP BTP price list links.

The SAP BTP Cockpit now offers a direct link between your data in the Costs and Usage page and the official SAP BTP price list, improving billing verification and cost transparency. You can easily access the correct BTP price list that matches your contract type, date, and currency, and directly link each billable item in the Costs and Usage - Billing view to its corresponding price list entry. This enhancement removes manual cross-checking and simplifies accurate cost validation.

For more information, see documentation.

4. Whatʼs Next in 2026?

Our journey doesn't stop here. We have an exciting roadmap ahead to further enhance your FinOps experience on SAP BTP.

  • Joule Chatbot for BTP FinOps: Soon, we plan to offer you the ability to simply ask questions about your BTP costs, trends and summaries to get instant answers via our AI copilot, Joule.
  • Intuitive Access to the Audit Log: We will streamlining traceability with direct, setup-free access to the Audit Log Viewer from the BTP cockpit.
  • Advanced Cross-Charge and Cost Allocation: We plan to enable advanced features to offer granular visibility below the subaccount level and the ability to allocate costs using FinOps tags across the account hierarchy, for example for business units, cost centers and projects.
  • Cost visibility & delegation​: We would like to allow subaccount administrators to gain deeper cost visibility, empowering them to monitor and manage their spending more effectively. 

All these innovations are planned to be integrated directly into the SAP BTP cockpit, delivering a unified, seamless experience for your BTP FinOps activities.

* This is the current state of planning and may be changed by SAP at any time.​

Stay tuned for more details via blogs and roadmap explorer.

entry.title: Use Datastore to avoid too many duplicate MPL attachments in exception retries
entry.content:
Use Datastore to avoid too many duplicate MPL attachments in exception retries

 

 

Introduction:

This blog post demonstrates how to use DataStore to retain Source payload & Intermediate Payload for error handling.

Common Practice is to write the Source Payload and intermediate payload (inflight payload) into MPL attachment using groovy script.

 

Problem:

In general, for Asynchronous scenario retry mechanism is placed to resend the failed message until the issue is fixed. Sometimes we want flexibility on retry mechanism without placing restriction on fixed number of retries.

This flexibility helps Interface to automatically resend the failed messages when target connection is resolved without manual intervention or when we are waiting for a change to move to production then it should automatically process the failed message.

This flexibility comes at a cost of writing the payload into MPL attachment every time message goes into error/exception. This fills up limited Monitoring Storage. If your interface is retried 100 times at least 100/200 MPL attachments will be created in Message Monitoring. This Problem is exaggerated if we have high volume interface.

 

We generally use exception subprocess to log source payload as an attachment using groovy script which is helpful during error for debugging later.

 

Groovy Script.

 

/* Refer the link below to learn more about the use cases of script.

https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/148851bf8192412cba1f9d2c17f4bd25.html

 

If you want to know more about the SCRIPT APIs, refer the link below

https://help.sap.com/doc/a56f52e1a58e4e2bac7f7adbf45b2e26/Cloud/en-US/index.html */

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;

 

 

def Message logExceptionPayloads(Message message) {                                      

    def body = message.getBody(String);

    def sourcePayload       = message.getProperties().get("sourcePayload");

    def exceptionMessage    = message.getProperties().get("exceptionMessage");

    def exceptionlogging    = message.getProperties().get("enableExceptionLog");

   

    if(exceptionlogging && exceptionlogging.equalsIgnoreCase("true")){

        def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message);

       

        if(messageLog != null){

            messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("1.Exception Log", exceptionMessage, "text/xml");

            messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("1.Source Payload",sourcePayload,"text/xml");

            messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("2.Inflight Payload",body,"text/xml");

        }

    }

}

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This creates lot of attachments for every run as we are attaching Source Payload, Inflight Payload and ExceptionLog based on the above groovy code.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Solution:

 

We were wondering if we can retain the flexibility of unrestricted message retries without the downside of so many attachments.

We stumbled upon the idea of utilizing datastore with override option to store the source payload and intermediate payload instead of MPL attachments using groovy script.

 

 

Above is the datastore approach where we are storing two payloads in Data Store.

  1. Intermediate or Inflight Payload- this is the transformed payload just before the error step
  2. Source Payload – Original Payload after entering the Integration flow.

 

set Exception Properties

 

 

 

 

 

Create errorDataStore Property  Error_${camelId} <Error_InterfaceID>

Create sourceMessage Property  SourcePayload_${header.SAP_MplCorrelationId}

Create inflightMessage Property InflightPayload_${header.SAP_MplCorrelationId}

 

We are appending SAP_MplCorrelationId header field for better search of failed message in datastore.

 

Write Inflight /Intermediate Payload

 

Write intermediate payload into data store as define in above Property errorDataStore

Give Datastore EntryID as  InflightPayload_${header.SAP_MplCorrelationId}

Make sure Overwrite Existing Message is checked. This will allow the same message to be overwritten in Datastore entry without creating multiple entries in case of multiple retries from JMS Queue.

 

 

 

 

 

get sourcePayload

 

get the source payload into the body which was stored in a sourcePayload Property using Content Modifier in the very first step of IntegrationFlow.

 

 

 

 

 

Write sourcePayload

Write the source payload into same datastore using Property errorDataStore with EntryID ${property.sourceMessage}. Make sure Overwrite Existing Message is checked. This will allow the same message to be overwritten in Datastore entry without creating multiple entries in case of multiple retries from JMS Queue.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Result

 

Datastore with only two entries are created even though we had 14 runs

 

 

 

 

 

 

Other Monitoring Observations

If the datastore entry for Retry message is deleted, then the status of the message in Monitoring will be changes to Cancelled, but this don’t prevent to re-create datastore again in next retry.

The status of the message in monitoring doesn’t revert to retry. This doesn’t prevent Message to keep retrying.  Once the issue is fixed and message status changes to Completed.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Once the message is successfully processed the status is changed to Completed

 

 

 

 

 

Later on, for successful messages you can remove the datastore entries by searching on correlation id which we have used to create EntryID. Alternative MPL ID ca also be used for cleanup.

 

Alternatively, APIs can also be used to automate to clean up data store entries on a scheduled basis. Below is the API reference.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public - Executing SOAP API upon Sales Order Creation (Before Save Logic)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are seeking guidance on the best practice for implementing a custom action triggered during the Sales Order creation process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Core Requirement

We need to implement a Before Save action (similar to a Pre-Exit logic) during the creation of a Sales Order (SO) by the Key User. The goal is that, once the Sales Order is successfully created in the system, the external SOAP API: https://api.sap.com/api/SERVICECONTRACTREQUEST_IN must be consumed and executed immediately.

 

Specific Technical Questions

1. Internal API Consumption via ABAP Environment (ADT)

Internal Consumption via ADT: Is it possible to consume this specific SOAP API directly within the ABAP Environment (ADT) using Developer Extensibility options (e.g., via EML (Entity Manipulation Language) or an internal release)? Or is this API strictly intended for external consumption (side-by-side extensibility via RAP, Java, or JavaScript)?

  • If internal consumption is possible, what is the recommended BAdI (Business Add-In) in the Sales Order flow that executes after all consistency checks but before the final commit to ensure API execution aligns with the SO creation?

 

2. Locking Behavior & Concurrency

Locking Behavior: If a Key User currently has the specific Sales Order open and is actively using it within the UI, will the API request fail due to a locking conflict if the API attempts to create a follow-up document?

  • In systems like SAP Business ByDesign, concurrent editing is strictly disallowed. We would like to confirm if S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition behaves similarly, and what implications this has for external API calls triggered by the Key User's save action.

Thank you for your insights and recommendations.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM Welcome Session | EMEA | AMER | English
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Have you recently requested provisioning of SAP Cloud ALM? We are thrilled to welcome you aboard! Your journey with #SAP Cloud ALM is about to begin, and we’re here to ensure it is smooth and efficient.

To assist you in this journey, we would like to invite you to one of the below online webinars where we’ll guide you through the setup process and answer any questions you may have.

What to Expect in the Webinar

The SAP Cloud ALM Welcome Webinar has been designed to ensure that you and your team are set up for success. During the session, we will:

  • Demonstrate the initial login procedures to access your SAP Cloud ALM tenant.
  • Provide guidance on the next steps to use the solution effectively.
  • Highlight essential training resources to support you and your team’s learning journey.
  • Answer any questions you may have during the session.

Your Next Steps

To make the most of your SAP Cloud ALM onboarding experience, here’s what you need to do:

  1. Share this information with your key stakeholders.

    • Ensure that IT Admins, Project Leads, and Implementation or Operations Partners responsible for SAP Cloud ALM are informed.
    • Don’t forget to forward the webinar invitation to your project implementation partner for their participation.

entry.title: Floor Stock Not Updating in SAP DM After Transfer Posting in S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

We are experiencing an issue with floor stock synchronization between SAP S/4HANA and SAP Digital Manufacturing (DM).

Scenario:
・We completed a SFC in SAP DM.
・This triggered a goods receipt to storage location F100 in S/4HANA.
・Afterwards, we manually performed a transfer posting (e.g., movement type 311) in S/4HANA to move the stock from F100 to G100.

Expected Result:
・The stock should be removed from F100 and appear only in G100, both in S/4HANA and SAP DM.

Actual Result:
・In S/4HANA, the stock correctly moved from F100 to G100.
・In SAP DM, stock appeared in G100, but the stock in F100 was not removed, resulting in duplicated inventory in DM.

We suspect that the movement from F100 to G100 was not correctly communicated back to DM, possibly due to transfer postings not being covered by the current DM–S/4 integration configuration.

Any guidance or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Staffing period validation for timesheet records
entry.content:
Default functionality of Period Validation for Timesheet:

  1. In "Manage My Timesheet" app, end users could maintain timesheet records for the project tasks based on the duration of the work package. Refer to KBA 3449051.
  2. In Timesheet API API_MANAGE_WORKFORCE_TIMESHEET, we have no period validation.

Customization using Timesheet Validation BADI:

Most of our customers want to customize this behavior by making a period validation based on resource staffing.
Here is a sample for implementing the Timesheet Validation BADI.

Step1: Go to Custom Logic App, Create New Enhanced Implementation.

Step2: Select Business Context – ‘HCM- Timesheet Validation', BAdI Description and give a name to your implementation.

Step 3:
Insert the below sample code snippet under logic:

    IF <fs_timenteries>-purchaseorder IS INITIAL.

      lv_wbselement = <fs_timenteries>-wbselement.

      SELECT SINGLE planlineitemuuid,

      resourcerequestuuid,

      fiscalperiod,

      fiscalyear

      FROM i_resourceassignmentplanitem

      WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS

      WHERE  workpackage = @<fs_timenteries>-wbselement

      AND employmentinternalid =  @<fs_timenteries>-personworkagreement

      AND fiscalyear = @LV_fc_year

      AND fiscalperiod = @LV_period

      and engagementprojectresource = @<fs_timenteries>-activitytype

      and plndeffortqty > 0

      INTO @DATA(ls_resourceplanitem).

      IF sy-subrc NE 0.

        CONCATENATE  'No staffing on Work Package Id'  <fs_timenteries>-wbselement

        INTO lv_error_msg  SEPARATED BY space.

        APPEND VALUE #( type  = 'E' message = lv_error_msg ) TO messages .
      Continue.

Step 4: Save the logic and Publish it.

Step 5: You should see a success message stating successful publishing of your BAdI.

entry.title: Re: Introduction to SAP S/4HANA Advanced Intercompany Sales
entry.content:
Dear @Weerakhan,

Hope you are doing well.

Let's firstly come to the conclusion: The advanced intercompany (aICO, 5D2) process, once activated, has a higher priority than the old ICO (1HO).

Whether the aICO or the old ICO process runs depends on several criteria:

  • If aICO is activated for sales document OR and item category TAN, then any TAN item in an OR sales order that is relevant for intercompany will start the new aICO process, with a few exceptions:
    1. Item is a sub item
    2. Item is configurable
    3. The item has a material ID for material determination
    4. …

You can get more details about restrictions and general information for advanced intercompany sales from the SAP Note 3192584 and the pdf attached with it at the end of the Note.

  • KBA 3192584 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Restrictions and General Information for Advanced Intercompany Sales 

Sincerely hope this issue has been made clear. I wish you all the best with your work and have a nice day!

Best Regards,
Zoe

entry.title: 资产负债表/损益表中的勾稽关系不平如何应对？
entry.content:
一.什么是勾稽关系？
勾稽关系指账簿和会计报表中有关数字之间存在的，可据以相互考察、核对的关系。这种关系是会计恒等式的核心，它确保了财务报表的内部一致性。每一项资产的增加都必须伴随负债或所有者权益的增加，或者是其他资产的减少。同样，每一项负债的增加，都必须伴随着资产的增加或者是所有者权益的减少。
这个关系帮助企业确保其记录的财务信息是完整和准确的，并且能够反映真实的财务状况。通过检查勾稽关系，财务人员可以验证资产负债表的正确性，发现可能的错误或遗漏。

二.资产负债表和损益表如何实现衔接？
按照会计标准，资产负债表和损益表主要通过“未分配利润”项目实现衔接关系。资产负债表中“未分配利润”的期末余额 - 资产负债表中“未分配利润”的期初余额 =损益表中当期“净利润”总额。

三.如何检查为何勾稽关系不平？
打开 “资产负债表/损益表 - 中国”应用，找到“未分配科目”（栏位）。执行以下检查：

 

 

1)检查制造费用科目（职能范围为“制造”的总账科目）的总和是否为 0。如果不为 0，则结转到 0。
查找受影响的订单/物料: 检查生产科目是否平衡的有效方法是按功能范围检查余额。

a) 打开应用日记账分录分析器。
b) 输入公司代码、会计年度和期间。
c) 仅在行中放置“功能范围”。通常，生产功能范围应为 YB20。如果 YB20 的余额为零，则表示生产科目应平衡。
d) 如果存在余额，您可以放出“订单标识”字段并清除其他字段。检查具有余额的确切订单。如果找到个别订单有余额，您可以单独分析这些订单来找到问题原因。

查找货币间的余额

a) 通常，活动类型重估仅能确保全球货币平衡。如果全球货币和公司代码货币不同，则可能存在以公司代码货币计的余额。
b) 还需要考虑的一点是，应在物料分类账关账后确保没有“未分配/未分摊”值。您可以通过物料价值流监控器应用检查相同的内容。
c) 如果维护手动活动价格，您需要使用正确的价格单位和正确的货币维护正确的手动活动价格。
d) 在编辑实际成本核算运行中，确保设置“再次处理”选项。
e) 要解决以全球货币计的未分配值，应在编辑实际成本核算运行的结算步骤中勾选“无库存覆盖范围检查”。

2)检查未分配科目中是否存在销售费用、管理费用和研发费用（职能范围为“销售/管理/研发”的总账科目）。如果存在，则余额总和应为 0。如果总和不为 0，则将其分配到 FSV 节点。

3)打开“管理全局层次结构”应用或者配置点 "定义会计报表版本"（ID:102669)，打开您为公司定义的资产负债表和损益表的财务报表版本，仔细检查是否存在任何不合理的配置。
例如，损益类科目是否分配到资产负债表中的 FSV 节点下或者对于一些总账科目，只选择了仅借方或仅贷方，但实际同时存在借方和贷方过账。例如下图中 D,C 两列都应该勾选，但客户只勾选了 D 列。

 

总体而言，一旦资产负债表/损益表中出现勾稽关系不平的问题，我们的财务工作者需要做大量细致的检查。
希望如上信息可以帮助到您。

Best regards,

Lola

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SAP BTP y Estrategias de Migración a SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos regaló una jornada técnica excepcional de la mano de Juan Pablo Barril, Experto SAP BASIS & BTP y RISE Cloud Architecture de @Kuaa_Technology Kuaatec, quien nos guió a través de dos pilares fundamentales de la transformación digital empresarial: SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) y las estrategias de migración a SAP S/4HANA.


SAP Business Technology Platform: Conectar e Innovar
¿Qué necesitan las organizaciones ganadoras?
Las empresas buscan agilidad e innovación para competir, transformarse y prosperar:

  • Reaccionar rápidamente a los cambios del mercado
  • Lograr resultados excepcionales y avances innovadores
  • Diferenciarse de la competencia
  • Capacidad de conectar aplicaciones, procesos y datos dispares

Las Tres Áreas de SAP BTP
1. App Dev & Automation
Experiencia low-code/no-code y herramientas pro-code
Automatización robótica de procesos
Gestión del flujo de trabajo

2. Data & Analytics
Productos de datos listos para la empresa
Toma de decisiones aumentada por IA
Plataforma de datos abiertos

3. Integration
3,800+ integraciones preconstruidas
4,400+ APIs y gráficos de datos
Integración de procesos E2E para soluciones SAP y no-SAP

Como mencionó Juan Pablo: "Estos proyectos de BTP son altamente muy rápidos, son proyectos cortos de dos, tres meses y las empresas necesitan esos cambios inmediatos."

SAP Build: La Solución Unificada
SAP Build Apps

  • Funciones visuales en la nube para aplicaciones de pila completa
  • Desarrollo colaborativo entre negocio y desarrolladores
  • Soporte multicanal para móviles y web
  • Integración vía API REST y OData

SAP Build Process Automation

  • Flujos de trabajo con arrastrar y soltar
  • Soluciones prediseñadas
  • IA incorporada para generación de procesos

Durante la presentación mostró un ejemplo de Purchase Requisition Approval, donde Joule ayuda a generar el requisition y crea automáticamente el flujo de trabajo completo.

Joule Studio
Permite crear agentes de IA personalizados:

  • Comprenden y resuelven problemas comerciales específicos
  • Experiencia conversacional unificada
  • Seguridad integrada de nivel empresarial

¿Por Dónde Empezar?
Juan Pablo compartió recursos clave:

  • SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Guías de decisión, arquitecturas de referencia y mejores prácticas
  • SAP Discovery Center: Casos de uso, historias de clientes y estimador de costos
  • SAP Learning: Más de 100 SAP Learning Journeys gratuitos
  • Free Tier and Trial: Probar SAP BTP sin costo inicial

"BTP se puede usar muchísimo... todo esto se puede también utilizar con una cuenta free trial. No te requiere hardware, lo único que vas a tener que instalar es un cloud connector."

Estrategias de Migración a SAP S/4HANA
Brownfield vs Greenfield
Brownfield (Conversión de Sistema)

  • Conversión técnica completa de SAP ERP existente a S/4HANA
  • Utilizar tecnología e instalaciones existentes
  • Comenzar rápidamente
  • Menor riesgo

Greenfield (Nueva Implementación)

  • Reingeniería y simplificación de procesos
  • Elegir nueva tecnología
  • Realizar carga de datos inicial
  • Mayor planificación inicial

SAP Readiness Check: El Punto de Partida
Juan Pablo explicó que esta herramienta indica qué tan preparado está el sistema para migrar a S/4HANA, analizando:

  • Compatibilidad técnica (versión, add-ons, extensiones)
  • Código ABAP y funciones obsoletas
  • Rendimiento y dimensionamiento
  • Procesos de negocio y oportunidades de mejora
  • Recomendaciones Fiori

"Se hace siempre previo a hacer las conversiones para tener una hoja de ruta real de cómo estamos parados hoy día del sistema y todos los ajustes que hay que hacer."

SAP Simplification Check
Muestra qué cambios concretos hacer en procesos, datos y funciones:
Verificación de Relevancia

Identifica qué Simplification Items aplican
Dimensiona el impacto funcional y técnico

Verificación de Consistencia

  • Comprueba que datos y procesos cumplan las nuevas estructuras
  • Detecta inconsistencias antes de la conversión

Conversión de Sistema: Fases Principales
Fase de Preparación:

  • Requerimientos del sistema
  • Maintenance Planner
  • Pre checks
  • Custom code preparation
  • Unicode conversion, OS & DB Version, SPAM Version

Fase de Realización:

  • SUM (Software Update Manager)
  • Migración DB
  • Software Update
  • Data Conversion

"Es importantísimo actualizar la SPAM. Es muy importantísimo porque las empresas vienen de sistemas viejos y tenemos que validar las versiones compatibles de base de datos y sistema operativo."

El Desafío del Código Custom
Juan Pablo fue claro sobre el mayor desafío:
"La tarea más ardua es todos los reportes que vamos a ver... la idea de SAP en la conversión es limpiar y tratar de minimizar al mínimo el tema de los desarrollos."
"Hay que analizar si esas aplicaciones llevarlas a código en BTP o directamente reemplazarla. Porque en muchos casos hay esa funcionalidad, alguien desarrolló algo y hoy día está disponible en las aplicaciones estándar."


Agradecemos a Kuaa technology por su patrocinio del SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025, haciendo posible estos espacios de aprendizaje en la comunidad SAP.
Un agradecimiento especial a Juan Pablo Barril por compartir su conocimiento técnico sobre SAP BTP y las estrategias de migración a S/4HANA de manera clara y práctica.
¡Gracias al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay!

entry.title: Articulation relationship of Balance Sheet/Income Statements is uneven
entry.content:
一.What is the Balancing Relationship?
The balancing relationship refers to the interconnections between numbers within accounting ledgers and financial statements that allow for mutual examination and verification. It forms the core of the accounting equation, which ensures the internal consistency of financial statements. In essence, whenever there is an increase in any asset, it must be matched by a corresponding increase in liabilities or owners' equity, or by a decrease in another asset. Similarly, every increase in liabilities must be mirrored by an increase in assets or a decrease in owners' equity.
This balancing act is crucial for companies to ensure that their recorded financial information is both complete and precise, accurately reflecting the true financial position. By regularly examining these relationships, financial personnel can verify the correctness of the balance sheet and identify potential errors or omissions.

二.Why is it Important?
The balancing relationship is more than just numbers on a page; it is a critical tool for maintaining the integrity of financial data. For businesses, it means that stakeholders can trust the information presented, which is essential for decision-making, compliance, and overall financial health. Mistakes in financial data can lead to poor strategic decisions, legal penalties, or damaged reputations.
In conclusion, understanding and maintaining the balancing relationship within financial statements is not merely about fulfilling accounting obligations—it is about fostering trust and transparency. As financial landscapes become more complex, mastering these fundamentals will continue to be vital for all companies striving for accuracy and integrity in their reporting.

三.How to Check Why the Balancing Relationship is Not Equilibrated?

Open the app "Balance Sheet/Income Statement" or app "Balance Sheet / Income Statement - China" and find the field Unassigned Accounts. Export these accounts under the tab Unassigned Accounts to spreadsheet (for example, Microsoft Excel), filter with “Functional Area”, and then do the following checks first:

1)Check whether the sum of manufacturing expense accounts (G/L accounts with functional area “manufacturing”) is 0. If it is not 0, carry forward to 0.
a)Open App Journal Entry Analyzer.
b)Input company code, fiscal year and period.
c)Only put "Functional Area" in Rows. Normally the production functional area should be YB20. If the balance for YB20 is zero, it means that the accounts for production should be balanced.
d)If there is balance, you can release the field "Order ID" and check for which exact order is with balance. Afterwards, you could make analysis on the specific order.

Balance between currencies

a)Normally the activity type revaluation will only ensure the global currency is balanced.
If you are using different currencies for global and company code currency, there might be balance in company code currency.
b)One more thing to consider is that you should make sure there is no "Not Distributed/Not Allocated" value after material ledger closing. You can check the same via app Material Value Flow Monitor.
c)If you maintain manual activity prices. You need to maintain the correct manual activity price with correct price unit and in the correct expected currency.
d)In Edit Actual Costing Run, make sure you set option "Process again".
e)To solve the Not Distributed value in global currency, you should tick "No stock coverage check" in Settlement step of Edit Actual Costing Run.

2)Check whether there are sales expenses, management expenses and R&D expenses (G/L accounts with functional areas “sales/management/R&D”) in the unassigned accounts. If there are, the sum of balance should be 0. If the sum is not 0, assign them to FSV nodes.

3)Open the app "Manage Global Hierarchies" or the or the configuration activity Define Financial Statement Versions（ID:102669) and open the financial statement version for Balance Sheet and Income Statement that you have defined for your company, double check whether there are any unreasonable configurations, for example, P&L accounts are assigned under FSV nodes in Balance Sheet; only Dr. or Cr. Indicator is selected for certain G/L accounts, but actually both debit and credit postings exist.

Hope the information could help you!

Best regards,

Lola

entry.content:

しかし、そのためにはMaintenance Certificateの更新が必要となりそうです。

現在Solmanを確認すると、Maintenance Certificateが期限切れのようでした。
また、SM37でジョブ「REFRESH_ADMIN_DATA_FROM_SUPPORT」は実行されていません。

Maintenance Certificateを自動更新したいと考えています。（Note1280664も確認済）
現状の確認結果のファイルをアップロードしました。

・[SPAM]Missing_Maintenance_Certificate　→SPAM実行時のエラー画面
・[SLICENSE]Maintenance_SYB_Expired　　→SLICENSEの画面
・[SOLMAN_SETUP]Schedule_Jobs　　　　→SOLMAN_SETUPの画面

Maintenance Certificateを自動更新させるようにする手順を教えてください。

平素よりお世話になっております。

ジョブ REFRESH_ADMIN_DATA_FROM_SUPPORT は、自動ライセンスデータ配布を有効化している管理対象システムのシステム番号をSAP Solution ManagerからSAP Support Portal へ送信する役割を担っております。

Maintenance Certificate を自動更新とするための具体的な手順および前提条件につきましては、以下のドキュメントをご参照いただけますようお願い申し上げます。

License Management Prerequisites

Automatic Distribution of License Data

また、ご指摘いただいた「SYBASE は対象外という記載」につきましては、SYBASEデータベース製品自体のMaintenance Certificateを指しております。

一方で、Solution ManagerのデータベースがSYBASEである場合でも、Solution ManagerシステムにMaintenance Certificateの自動更新機能は問題なくご利用いただけます。

ご不明な点や追加のご質問がございましたら、どうぞ遠慮なくお知らせください。

宜しくお願い致します。

entry.title: SAP TRM Borrowings: Contracts Upload along with Interest Conditions and Repayment Conditions
entry.content:
This blog is mainly addressed to the migration of legacy Interest Conditions and Repayment Conditions during migration of TRM Borrowings contracts in the Cutover phase.

For the migration of TRM legacy contracts, we generally find it easier to migrate the data required in the following tabs of a TRM contract: -

  • Structure tab
  • Administration tab
  • Other Flows tab
  • Payment Details tab

To populate the data in the above-mentioned tabs, the respective tabs (i.e., Structure, Administration, Other Flows, and Payment Details) are available in the Migration Cockpit template. This template can be downloaded using Fiori App – Migrate Your Data (App ID: DMC_WDA) for the migration object ‘TRM – Interest Rate Instrument’. 

Helpful SAP tables for the migration of SAP TRM contracts: VTBFHA, VTBFHAPO, VTBFHAZU, VTBKINKO, and VTBZV.  

However, we generally face difficulties in the migration of legacy as well as future conditions/flows of the Interest Conditions (Condition Group - 1000) and Repayment Conditions (Condition group - 2000). In the standard system, interest flow of 1200 is part of Interest Conditions, and repayment flows of 1120, 1130 & 1140 are part of Repayment Conditions. The project learnings shared below might be helpful for the migration of such conditions of TRM Borrowings contracts in your project.

If we need to fetch contracts data from a legacy SAP system to populate the Condition tab of the migration template: -

  • Fetch all the conditions from SAP table VTBFHAPO where Condition Group = 1000 (Interest Conditions) or 2000 (Repayment Conditions)
  • Relevant VTBFHAPO fields: Condition Type, Condition Group, Condition Item Effective From, Condition Amount, Payment Currency, Calculation From Date, Due Date and Frequency

Once contracts data is available to populate the migration template (i.e., after extraction or manual upload): -

  • Enhance standard migration cockpit template to add ‘Amount Calculation Rule’ field using t-code LTMOM.
  • For the first Interest Condition of a contract in the Conditions tab, the Effective From Date, Condition Amount, Calculation To Date and Due Date in the Conditions tab must match with Interest Structure details on the Structure tab as highlighted below: -

Conditions tab: -

Structure tab: -

 

  • For the first Repayment Condition of a contract in the Conditions tab, the Effective From Date, Condition Amount, Calculation To Date and Due Date in the Conditions tab must match with Interest Structure details on the Structure tab as highlighted below: -

Conditions tab: -

Structure tab: -

 

  • For legacy Interest conditions line items (i.e., conditions with Due Date in the past when compared to the Cutover Date),
    • the conditions amounts to be uploaded with Amount Calculation Rule = 3 (Amount), however, Reference Interest Rate and Markup/Down to be kept as BLANK
    • Frequency and Unit for Frequency to be kept as zero.

 

  • For future Interest conditions line items (i.e., conditions with Due Date in the future when compared to the Cutover Date),
    • In case of contracts with variable interest rates, the Amount Calculation Rule = 2 (Variable) with applicable frequency and variable interest rate (along with Markup/Down, if applicable), but Condition Amount and Currency fields to be kept as BLANK in the Conditions tab
    • In case of contracts with fixed or amount-based interest rates, the Amount Calculation Rule = 3 (Amount) along with appropriate values in the Condition Amount and Currency fields
    • Frequency and Unit for Frequency as applicable
  • For all Repayment conditions line items (legacy or future), the conditions amounts to be uploaded with Amount Calculation Rule = 3 (Amount), however, Reference Interest Rate and Markup/Down are not applicable.

I hope these project experiences will be of help during migration of TRM Borrowings contracts in your project. Open to your feedback and value learning from your experiences as well.

entry.title: Using Settlement Account for Non-Material Receivers in Production Order Settlement
entry.content:
This blog will introduce non-material settlement receiver features in  Event-Based Production Cost Posting (3F0)

Business Scenarios

For manufacturing orders in SAP Cloud ERP system, accounting journal entries associated with business transaction events -raw material consumptions, activity confirmations and goods receipts reflect manufacturing costing process in management accounting. The balances of orders are usually settled to materials as variance postings. However, sometimes, order settlement receivers may not be materials, rather they are cost centers, WBS elements or other orders. For example, orders may need to be settled to cost centers as research expenses.

Product Features

In configuration Event-Based Processing Key,  as in the screenshot below, in addition to Material, Cost center, WBS Element and Order are also supported.

In Non-Material Account Determination Rule, two methods are supported: By Original Account and By Settlement Account.(Please refer to official documentation Event-Based Cost Distribution (Non-MAT Receivers) for more details)

A settlement account needs to be maintained if settlement account option is chosen.

Process Illustrations

We will show the steps of creating a production order, maintain settlement rule, perform postings and settlements. A production order is being created and navigate to settlement rule to make a cost center as receiver.

Maintain the settlement rule to a cost center

After performing material good issues, activity confirmations. The order balance is always zero, as the costs are re-posted to cost centers.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We can also view the order in Fiori app Display Document Flow, and it generates six documents, of which doc1,2,4,5 are trigged by goods issues, activity confirmations and overhead (as costing sheet is used in the demo) as expected for any other orders regardless of receivers in settlement rules.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For the tagged doc 3 and 6 in above screenshot, they show the settlement postings from the order to the cost center. The two journal entries are shown below(for materials and activity type amount settlements respectively), the settlement G/L account maintained in Event-Based Processing Key is being used.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The cost center report should show the postings under settlement account, which may need to be included in financial statement version to include the expenses in income statement report.

Summary

The above has illustrated the product features with regards to cost center as receiver in production order settlement using settlement account approach. Feel free the leave comments below and explore other blogs and content in the community.

entry.title: Production Order Settlement to WBS Elements
entry.content:
In the previous blog, Using Settlement Account for Non-Material Receivers in Production Order Settlement, we discussed and illustrated production order settlement to a cost center; however, the settlement account was a 2nd cost element, and it needed to be included in the financial report to reflect the expenses in income statement. What if we want to settle the costs to cost centers via primary cost elements. We can achieve this with the help of WBS elements as settlement receivers. We will illustrate this process below.

Firstly, a project is created.

Maintain the settlement rule of WBS as G/L Category. A primary cost element account is entered here. (This expense account needs to set up cost center as default account assignment in configuration or BAdI)

We create a production order without material (CO07)

Maintain order settlement rule as WBS element Category with previous created WBS element

After the activity confirmations have been performed on the production order. As can be seen below, the WBS element receives all the activity confirmation postings from the production order.

We perform Project settlement job and view the settlement document

 

A closer look at the accounting document generated from WBS settlement. The expense has been posted to the cost center.

Conclusion

Since production order settlement does not support G/L Account as receiver or settlement account as a primary cost element, WBS elements can be used to receive the postings from production orders first and then be settled to cost centers via a primary cost element account.
